doc:
Fay Templeton https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fay_Templeton 0 Fay Templeton (December 25, 1865 – October 3, 1939) was an American actress, singer, songwriter and comedian. Her parents were actors/vaudevillians and she followed in their footsteps, making her Broadway debut in 1900. Templeton excelled on the legitimate and vaudeville stages for more than half a century. She was a favorite headliner and heroine of popular theater, appearing until 1934. For a time she dated Sam Shubert, of the Shubert family of theatre owners, up until his death in a railroad accident. Some of her notable performances were in H.M.S. Pinafore and Roberta. In an age of buxom beauties, she was particularly buxom, playing romantic leads despite her weight. Fay_Templeton ( December_25_,_1865 – October_3_,_1939 ) was an_American_actress , singer , songwriter_and_comedian . Her_parents were actors/vaudevillians and she followed in their_footsteps , making her_Broadway_debut in 1900 . Templeton excelled on the_legitimate_and_vaudeville_stages for more_than_half_a_century . She was a_favorite_headliner_and_heroine of popular_theater , appearing until 1934 . For a_time she dated Sam_Shubert , of the_Shubert_family of theatre_owners , up until his_death in a_railroad_accident . Some of her_notable_performances were in H.M.S._Pinafore_and_Roberta . In an_age of buxom_beauties , she was particularly_buxom , playing romantic_leads despite her_weight .
